attributes.action: Support the continuation of breastfeeding for working mothers
attributes.additional_details:
Many other countries have support in place for breastfeeding to continue, eg Portugal has a 'breastfeeding license' which reduces the working day by 2 hours, this would allow a mother to arrive later, leave earlier, pop home during the day to feed or to use the time during the working day to pump to provide milk for when they are away.

Many women need to return to work and a change like this would allow them to provide financially as well as physically for their child.
attributes.background: There are benefits to mother and child for extended breastfeeding with the WHO recommends breastfeeding for the first 2 years of life. Many women find the return to work makes continuing breastfeeding difficult, other countries have support in place for this to continue.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about supporting working mothers who are breastfeeding, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the UK Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You can find information about breastfeeding and going back to work here: 
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/pregnancy-and-baby/breastfeeding-back-to-work/
